windows.title: LearnWith.ai Q3 2024 Budget Update - Google Docs - Google Chrome

content.title: Q2 Progress
content.visibleText:
Q2 Progress
During Q2 we built out the core functionality of the Magic Academy game, leveraging the work that was done on TeachTower, and preserving the tower as a central feature to represent academic progression.
1. Built an MVP
 a. Customizable characters (380+ options, leveraging the Unity asset store)
 b. Equipment system (100+ items to earn through play)
 c. Combat
 d. Pets
 e. Academic questions as fuel
 f. Tower represents your academic progress
 g. Real-world rewards
2. Conducted Play Testing
 a. Kids played a lot and were especially motivated by the real-world rewards
 b. Math content was a positive for the student testers (kids see it as an opportunity to show off what they have learned)
3. Ran a Beta Program
 a. Positive feedback: character customization, fun to explore the world, excited about rewards
 b. Negative feedback: math questions too easy, need more explanation on how to start, want more game content]
4. Launched!
 a. Website
 b. Metrics dashboard
In the first week after launch, we have averaged 2.4 sessions per user with over 16 minutes played per session. Kids have answered more than 60 math questions each.

content.title: Q3 Plans
content.visibleText:
Q3 Plans
In Q3 we plan to shift our energy toward user acquisition and monetization. Key to this strategy is selling parents on the value as part of the user acquisition funnel with targeted landing pages and supporting research. We will build out proof points of program effectiveness both to validate the core strategy and to compel parents to make subsequent purchases.
1. Acquire users through social and mobile ads
